title: How To Listen To And Understand Opera (Unabridged)
description:
32 lectures, 45 minutes per lecture.

Taught by Robert Greenberg Ph.D., 
University of California at Berkeley.

For more than 400 years, opera has been one of the most popular performing arts. Geniuses such as Monteverdi, Mozart, Verdi, Wagner and Puccini have produced some of the landmark artistic achievements of all time in this form. 

With Professor Robert Greenberg to show you how, you can learn to understand, appreciate and even to love opera in just 24 hours of lectures that are a pleasure to hear. 

Armed with the knowledge of opera gained from this course, you will understand how music has the power to reveal truths beyond the spoken word; how opera is a unique marriage of words and music in which the whole is far greater than its parts. You will learn the reasons for opera's enduring popularity. And you will be able to explore in greater depth the extraordinary and compelling world of opera.
